required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Chemotherapy on PD-L1 in NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Platinum-based Chemotherapy on PD-L1 Expression in Patients With Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: PD-L1 is identified as an important biomarkers for predicting PD-1/PD-L1 inhibitors in advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer. Several previous clinical trials have demonstrated that chemotherapy could enhance the efficacy of PD-1/L1 immunotherapy in NSCLC such as Checkmate-227, Impower-150, Keynote-189, etc. Pre-clincial experiment shows that chemotherapy could increase CD8 TIL infiltration in tumor microenvironment, activate T cell immune reaction. However, it remains unclear whether chemotherapy could affect PD-L1 in advanced NSCLC patients. The present study aims to evaluate whether PD-L1 will change after receiving chemotherapy in advanced NSCLC patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with PD-L1 positive as assessed by immunohistochemical assay
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: PD-L1 will be calculated using immunohistochemical assay

intervention.description: PD-L1 expression is evaluated using immunohistochemical assay

study_pop.textblock: Advanced NSCLC without druggable molecular events (EGFR, ALK, c-Met, BRAF, Ret, etc)
